intro: Gallitrichum arvale, commonly known as the red sandalwood, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces elongated, woody pods that contain several seeds. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. Gallitrichum arvale is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
